summary: I’m having a really hard time. I really want to be a Jonerys supporter, I want to try to remember the good parts of Thrones. I...
body:
I’m having a really hard time. I really want to be a Jonerys supporter, I want to try to remember the good parts of Thrones. I want to regain the innocent hope of the finished book series one day. But I just feel so awful.

I can’t stop thinking about what happened to Jon and to Daenerys. How awful it is. I believed in them and in their love so strongly. There was so much wasted. I have seen a lot of negative things about Jon on my dash since Sunday. I can’t blame people. I totally get it. It was awful, so fucking awful. And a blog that I followed for years and respected and liked blocked me just for suggesting that they were being insensitive to Dany fans. I mean this blog was celebrating Jon’s happy ending just minutes after the finale’s end. I felt awful. Jon didn’t have a happy ending! He’s a Queenslayer, a kinslayer, he lied! he kissed her and then killed her! I cannot believe this character was used for that end. I cannot believe they did that to Daenerys. How awful and sad and how can anyone be proud and happy over that!?

I feel sick. Those two were always my favorite characters. I loved them. I loved others but those were always my top. My besties. My loves. They should have died together. They should have been heroes.

This is very rambly and I am sorry. I just feel sick. I have unfollowed so many people already. First because people believed the leaks about The Scene. Turned out they were right and I feel awful for that. Then I unfollowed people for reblogging pics/gifs of That Scene. Now I want to unfollow people for negative D&D posts. Not because I disagree, but because it just reminds me of every single reason that I feel so awful.

I don’t know what to do. I want to be in this fandom, i want to be supportive and ship Jonerys and I want to even write fanfic. But i just feel so awful. I’m the one that needs help and support now, too. What should I do??!

summary:
II can’t help it; the scene of Drogon carrying Daenerys’s body away
towards the east was just too powerful and didn’t leave me...
caption:
II can’t help it; the scene of Drogon carrying Daenerys’s body away towards the east was just too powerful and didn’t leave me alone. I had to write this: “The Night is Not Alive”. Sorry.

The young shepherd had become obsessed with the dragon and the Khaleesi and spent almost all his time watching them. He raised his tent nearby and although he never dared to venture too close, he liked to think that the dragon endured his company better than he did that of the others.

Million thanks to lovely @hardlyfatal, who soldiered on despite her sore shoulder and betaed this work! (Warning for sadness)

summary: Ultimately, I think Dany losing and channeling her inner Aerys is actually not that from unlikely in GRRMs original plan - the...
body:
Ultimately, I think Dany losing and channeling her inner Aerys is actually not that from unlikely in GRRMs original plan - the Targs are not really presented as the right choice for Westeros, in any meaningful form - though I doubt he’ll do it in the awful way they did it in the show.

It’s very odd being on this side of this sort of dispute, tbh. even if only loosely,.

summary: A lot has been said about D&Ds terrible dialogue writing, but I think the greatest sign of their weakness is that they straight...
body:
A lot has been said about D&Ds terrible dialogue writing, but I think the greatest sign of their weakness is that they straight up don’t write the most important parts of their conversations.

Jaime arrives at Winterfell and sees Bran for the first time? Cut away and go straight to the trial! Why actually write that first remeeting or Jaime getting caught at all? Just skip to the trial.

Arya and Sansa finding out about Jon’s parentage? Cut it before the actual reveal. It’s not like this is mind blowing info we would love to see the characters react to or anything.

Sansa asks Jon if he bent the knee for love or for the north? Cut before he responds. Did he just walk out? What did he say?

Tyrion pulls up a chair to hear Bran’s story which is, presumably, what convinces him to later suggest Bran as king? Cut before the actual story, which means we don’t actually know what convinced Tyrion.

Sansa decides to tell Tyrion about Jon’s heritage which is a VERY MAJOR MOMENT for EVERYONE in the story? Cut before she actually reveals it.

Jon kills Daenerys and assumedly some major shit happens? Cut before anyone discovers it and just skip to later so that we don’t have to deal with that scene.

And do you know why they do it? Its so they can avoid the most difficult bits to write and instead let YOU imagine the conversation. It forces the audience to fill in the gaps and do most of the work while they get to just fuck off to the next scene. And this problem shows in their writing on a larger scale because they are allergic to emotional pay off in any fashion, which is why so many character arcs feel weak and so many plot threads are left hanging because they just do not feel the need to tie things up. They’d rather everyone else do the work for them and then praise them for their genius.

blog.name: aria-karina
blog.title: Leave me to dream...
blog.description: Film student, film lover. Proud Mexican and well I reblog random stuff from GoT, Marvel and SW to artistic films. Have I mentioned that i love Oscar Isaac, Benedict Cumberbatch and Tom Hiddleston the most? No? Then now you know.

summary: Emilia is not Daenerys
body:
Emilia is not Daenerys

I understand that you don’t agree with Emilia Clarke and the fact that she tried to defend Dany but honestly, why would you attack her?

The writing was pure crap, even when I wanted Dark Dany it felt rushed and with very little development. Emilia literally owes her acting career to this show and that character, of course she loves Daenerys and she is obviously more invested in it than the rest of us and yes it felt wrong because it wasn’t developed enough for her! I don’t like Daenerys, and yes, the Mad Queen was forshadowed but if it had had more development the season would have been fantastic and she’d understand it more as an actress portraying a character that has been a part of her life.

Also let me remind you all that Emilia Clarke is an actual real human being and we are all entitled to our own opinions so she literally can say whatever she wants even if we don’t agree or don’t like Dany.

Daenerys can literally burn but leave Emilia alone. You are hurting real people over fictional characters.

I understand that you don’t agree with Emilia Clarke and the fact that she tried to defend Dany but honestly, why would you attack her?

The writing was pure crap, even when I wanted Dark Dany it felt rushed and with very little development. Emilia literally owes her acting career to this show and that character, of course she loves Daenerys and she is obviously more invested in it than the rest of us and yes it felt wrong because it wasn’t developed enough for her! I don’t like Daenerys, and yes, the Mad Queen was forshadowed but if it had had more development the season would have been fantastic and she’d understand it more as an actress portraying a character that has been a part of her life.

Also let me remind you all that Emilia Clarke is an actual real human being and we are all entitled to our own opinions so she literally can say whatever she wants even if we don’t agree or don’t like Dany.

Daenerys can literally burn but leave Emilia alone. You are hurting real people over fictional characters.

summary: (Apparently) Unpopular Opinion
body:
(Apparently) Unpopular Opinion

I love Daenerys Targaryen.

I love Sansa Stark.

I love both of my powerful queens. Apparently most Dany stans are anti-Sansa and vice versa.

I love them both. They are both beautiful, wonderful, extraordinary people. Fight me.
